activities: SAS is a global leader in business intelligence and predictive analytics software.  Its business in Europe is conducted by SAS affiliates.  SAS receives personal information in various forms relating to European workers of SAS affiliates.  SAS processes worker personal information transferred from the European Union to the United States for customary human resources, workforce management and similar functions. SAS Solutions OnDemand (SSO) receives and stores EU and Swiss personal data on its hosted software products.  In these instances, SSO acts as a data processor for data controllers located in Europe.  SSO does not determine the type of data that is uploaded onto the servers, and any access to or use of such data is incidental to completing SSO's contractual obligations to its customer as a processor.
contacttitle1: Senior Vice President & Chief Legal Officer
corpofftitle1: Senior Vice President & Chief Legal Officer
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
recoursemech: TRUSTe; EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC) for HR personal data
